intro: Muretia transcaspica, commonly known as the Transcaspian muretia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Muretia transcaspica is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
